marketplaces.name: nsfw-feature-dev
marketplaces.description: Nashville Super Fun Work Team's comprehensive feature development skill suite

files.README.md:
# Feature Development Skill Suite

> Build features the right way from the start with comprehensive AI-guided planning

## What Does This Do? (ELI5)

Imagine you're building a house. You don't just start laying bricksâ€”you need a blueprint first! This plugin asks you smart questions about your feature (like "what are the security risks?", "how many users will it have?", "how will we test it?"), then creates a detailed step-by-step plan that covers everything important.

But here's the cool part: the plan is SO detailed that it would be huge and hard to follow. So we break it into smaller, manageable plans that Claude can actually work with.

**In short:** Questions â†’ Big Plan â†’ Smaller Plans â†’ Build!

## Installation

### One-Step Setup

```
/plugin marketplace add NSFWteam/skill-feature-dev
/plugin install nsfw-feature-dev@nsfw-feature-dev
```

### Keep Updated

```
/plugin marketplace update
```

This pulls the latest improvements and features from the main branch.

## The 5-Step Workflow

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[ðŸŽ¤ Interview] -->|Questions| B[ðŸ“‹ Plan]
    B -->|Big plan| C[âœ‚ï¸ Decompose]
    C -->|Smaller plans| D[ðŸ”§ Integrate]
    D -->|Tool setup| E[âš¡ Execute]
    
    style A fill:#4CAF50,color:#fff
    style B fill:#2196F3,color:#fff
    style C fill:#FF9800,color:#fff
    style D fill:#9C27B0,color:#fff
    style E fill:#F44336,color:#fff
```

### Step 1: **Interview** - Ask the right questions
Claude asks you about your feature (security, scalability, testing, tech stack, etc.) and saves your answers.

```
/nsfw-interview
```

### Step 2: **Plan** - Create a detailed blueprint  
Uses your interview answers to write a comprehensive plan with architecture, security measures, testing strategy, and more.

```
/nsfw-plan
```

### Step 3: **Decompose** - Break it into chunks
Splits the big plan into smaller, focused plans (30k-80k tokens each) that Claude can actually execute. Each includes TDD requirements.

```
/nsfw-decompose
```

### Step 4: **Integrate** - Pick the right tools
Figures out which AI agents, MCP servers, or skills would be best for each mini-plan.

```
/nsfw-integrate
```

### Step 5: **Execute** - Build it!
Runs each mini-plan with the configured tools. You can do them one at a time or in parallel.

```
/nsfw-execute
```

---

## What Gets Generated?

After running these commands, you'll have a `docs/plans/` folder with:

```
docs/plans/
â”œâ”€â”€ payment-system/                           # Your feature
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ payment-system-comprehensive.md       # The big plan
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ payment-system-interview-data.json    # Your answers
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mini-plans/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ mini-plan-001.md                  # Database setup
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ mini-plan-002.md                  # Payment API
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ mini-plan-003.md                  # Security layer
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ decomposition-manifest.md         # How to execute them
â””â”€â”€ codebase-analysis/                        # (if existing project)
    â””â”€â”€ summary-2024-01-24.md                 # Architecture notes
```

## What Always Gets Covered?

Every feature plan includes mandatory analysis of:

- âœ… **Security** - OWASP TOP 10 vulnerabilities
- âœ… **Scalability** - Can it handle growth?
- âœ… **Performance** - Will it be fast?
- âœ… **Logging** - Can we see what's happening?
- âœ… **Containerization** - How does it deploy?
- âœ… **TDD** - Test-driven development (HARD REQUIREMENT)

Plus: Tech stack, databases, APIs, authentication, monitoring, CI/CD, error handling, and more.

## Supported Tech Stacks

| Language | Backend | Frontend | Testing |
|----------|---------|----------|---------|
| **.NET** | ASP.NET Core, Minimal APIs | Blazor Server/WASM/Hybrid | xUnit, NUnit, MSTest, bUnit |
| **Node.js** | Express, Fastify, NestJS | React, Vue, Next.js, Angular | Jest, Mocha, Vitest, Cypress |

## How It Uses AI

- **Claude Opus 4.5** with Extended Thinking (deep analysis)
- **Greenfield mode**: Questions assume a new project
- **Brownfield mode**: Analyzes your existing codebase first

## Why This Works

âœ¨ **Smart Decomposition** - Breaks big plans into chunks Claude can handle (30k-80k tokens)  
ðŸ”’ **Security First** - OWASP TOP 10 analysis in every plan  
ðŸ§ª **TDD Built-in** - Testing requirements in every mini-plan  
âš¡ **Run in Parallel** - Independent parts execute simultaneously  
ðŸ†• **Greenfield & Existing** - Works with new projects or existing codebases  
ðŸ§  **Deep Thinking** - Uses Claude's extended thinking for better decisions

## Updates

Stay up to date with the latest features and improvements:

```
/plugin marketplace update
```

We continuously improve the plugin with new features, bug fixes, and enhancements. Check the [GitHub releases](https://github.com/NSFWteam/skill-feature-dev/releases) to see what's new.

## Future Enhancements

- [ ] GitHub Copilot CLI integration
- [ ] Real-time token tracking during execution
- [ ] Visual progress dashboards
- [ ] Integration with project management tools
- [ ] Template library for common feature patterns
- [ ] AI-powered mini-plan optimization based on historical data

## Best Practices

1. **Interview thoroughly**: The quality of your plan depends on interview completeness
2. **Review comprehensive plan**: Before decomposition, validate the plan covers all needs
3. **Customize integration**: Adjust tool recommendations based on your environment
4. **Execute incrementally**: Run mini-plans one at a time initially to validate approach
5. **Monitor token usage**: Track actual vs estimated tokens to improve future estimates

## Support & Customization

This skill is highly customizable. Edit:
- `prompts/*.md`: Modify interview questions or plan structure
- `config/skill-config.json`: Adjust token budgets or add languages
- `utils/agent-selector.js`: Add custom tool recommendation logic

## License

MIT

---

**Version**: 1.0.0  
**Model**: Claude Opus 4.5 with Extended Thinking  
**Platform**: Claude Code (with future GitHub Copilot support)
